normalised: Okay, so someone asked about good venues for a wedding reception in Delhi N-C-R, right? Well, bhai, let me tell you, the choices are endless... and mostly overpriced, L-O-L. First off, figure out your budget. Are we talking lakhs or crores for the banquet hall? Seriously! Some of these places near Gurgaon charge like rupee five thousand per plate! My advice? Check out some of the farmhouse type places on the outskirts. You might actually get decent parking that way and not be stuck in a Sector eighteen Noida type traffic jam!

unnormalised: Next, think about your guest list. Are we talking 200 people or 2000? Because that makes a HUGE difference. A cozy little "function hall" at a local community center in, say, Dwarka Sec-10, might be perfect for a smaller group, but a complete disaster for a big fat Punjabi wedding. Also, consider the season. If it's peak wedding season (like Nov-Dec), book WAY in advance. Like, NOW. Don't wait till the last minute, or you'll be stuck with that weird hall above the Vishal Mega Mart on GT Karnal Road!
normalised: Next, think about your guest list. Are we talking two hundred people or two thousand? Because that makes a huge difference. A cozy little function hall at a local community center in, say, Dwarka S-e-c-ten, might be perfect for a smaller group, but a complete disaster for a big fat Punjabi wedding. Also, consider the season. If it's peak wedding season (like November-December), book way in advance. Like, now. Don't wait till the last minute, or you'll be stuck with that weird hall above the Vishal Mega Mart on G-T Karnal Road!

unnormalised: Finally, and I can't stress this enough: VISIT THE VENUE. Don't just look at the pictures online (they are ALWAYS photoshopped). Go there, check out the bathrooms (important!), the parking, the sound system (they always claim "state of the art," but...), and the *catering*. Ask to taste the food! And bargain hard, my friend. Bargain like you're buying vegetables at Azadpur Mandi. Good luck finding your "dream" venue. May the odds (and the traffic) be ever in your favour!
